Levels.Patient: Person with emotionally unstable personality disorder (borderline type)

Zanarini-1.Description: Inappropriate, intense anger, or difficulty controlling anger

Zanarini-2.Description: Affective instability due to a marked reactivity of mood

Zanarini-4.Description: Identity disturbance: markedly and persistently unstable self-image or sense of self

Zanarini-5.Description: Transient stress-related paranoid ideation or severe dissociative symptoms

Zanarini-6.Description: Frantic efforts to avoid real or imagined abandonment

Zanarini-7.Description: Recurrent suicidal behaviour, gestures, or threats, or self-mutilating behaviour

Zanarini-8.Description: Impulsivity in at least two other areas that are potentially self-damaging

Zanarini-9.Description: Pattern of unstable and intense interpersonal relationships characterized by alternating between extremes of idealization and devaluation

CTQ-PhysAbuse.LongName: Childhood trauma questionnaire physical abuse score

CTQ-EmotAbuse.LongName: Childhood trauma questionnaire emotional abuse score

CTQ-SexAbuse.LongName: Childhood trauma questionnaire sexual abuse score

CTQ-PhysNeglect.LongName: Childhood trauma questionnaire physical neglect score

CTQ-EmotNeglect.LongName: Childhood trauma questionnaire emotional neglect score

drug-1.Description: Medication being taken by the participant at the time of scanning, where applicable.

drug-2.Description: Medication being taken by the participant at the time of scanning, where applicable.

drug-3.Description: Medication being taken by the participant at the time of scanning, where applicable.
